body:
@visarya 
As a workaround for projects or dependencies  following works:


**This workaround works on my pipeline.** 

_Project Step:_ 
1. Add to the package.json following: "typeorm": "^0.2.42",
The package wouldn't be downloaded again because an dependency already had it.


_Pipeline Steps/Local Steps_
2. run `npm install`

3. run `npm remove typeorm`

4. run `npm install typeorm@0.2.41`
facing the same issue. Even i was on old version `^0.2.25`. My deployments are failing suddenly

we can export StringUtils, it's not an issue. But the question is what change bring this error. I bet it's something related to new ESM support. @giladgd do you have any ideas if your PR #8536 could introduce this kind of issue?
I am wondering how its  affecting older versions ? `^0.2.25 `

> I am wondering how its affecting older versions ? ^0.2.25

it doesn't affect old version, because of `^` it installs the latest right now on your machine.
Appears to be related to ESM:
any hints on how to reproduce this issue at it's minimal (without other big dependencies like nestjs, etc)
@pleerock Just use the `typeorm-naming-strategies` package (snake case strategy for example) in your connection config

> > I am wondering how its affecting older versions ? ^0.2.25
> 
> it doesn't affect old version, because of `^` it installs the latest right now on your machine.

Yes minor version issue.

issue.title: fix: support `require` to internal files without explicitly writing `.js` in the path

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
### Description of change
Support using `require` on internal module files without explicitly writing `.js` at the end of the path.

For example, this code would work now:
```js
// in ESM projects
import {snakeCase} from "typeorm/util/StringUtils.js";

// in CommonJS projects
const {snakeCase: snakeCase1} = require("typeorm/util/StringUtils"); // this line previously thrown an error, this PR fixes that
const {snakeCase: snakeCase2} = require("typeorm/util/StringUtils.js");

console.log(snakeCase === snakeCase1); // true
console.log(snakeCase === snakeCase2); // true
```

Closes #8656
Closes https://github.com/tonivj5/typeorm-naming-strategies/issues/16

### Pull-Request Checklist
- [x] Code is up-to-date with the `master` branch
- [x] `npm run lint` passes with this change
- [x] `npm run test` passes with this change
- [x] This pull request links relevant issues as `Fixes #0000`
- [ ] There are new or updated unit tests validating the change - _The change in this PR is hard to create a test for from within the module itself, since the `exports` property in `package.json` only reflects imports of the module from the outside, and does not affect internal file imports_
- [ ] Documentation has been updated to reflect this change - N/A
- [x] The new commits follow conventions explained in [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)

body:
@pleerock I managed to reproduce the issue and fix it.
I've opened #8660 to fix this issue
@giladgd thanks for urgent response, fix was released in `0.2.43`.
